Historian Gudni Johannesson has claimed victory in Iceland’s presidential election. The new president said his first job would be to fly to France to support his country's team against England on Monday.

Nigel Farage has said Britain is heading for a “mild” recession but says it has nothing to do with Brexit. The victorious Leave campaigner rejected warnings that leaving the European Union would have dire consequences for the UK economy, even as markets were rocked by Thursday’s result.

The United Nations issued a strongly worded statement on Friday warning that any attempt by the European Union to bypass national parliaments to push through controversial trade deals would violate international human rights norms and standards.
